intro: Cousinia pseudodshizakensis, commonly known as the Karakorum gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Karakorum Mountains in Pakistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in its native habitat. Cousinia pseudodshizakensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
